bio: Lia is a renowned Bangladeshi chef, known for her expertise in traditional Bangladeshi cuisine. With a passion for cooking that started at a young age, Lia has worked at several renowned restaurants in Bangladesh and won awards for her innovative recipes. Now based in bangladesh, Lia continues to introduce new dishes and techniques while staying true to the authentic flavors of Bangladeshi cuisine

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
recipes.cooking_method: Hilsa Fish in Mustard Sauce: Shorshe Ilish is a traditional Bangladeshi fish recipe that is made with Hilsa fish, a popular fish in the country. The fish is cooked in a sauce made from yellow mustard seeds, white poppy seeds, and green chilies. To make shorshe ilish, the fish is marinated with turmeric and salt, then pan-fried until golden brown.

recipes.name: Chingri Malai Curry
recipes.cooking_method: Prawn in Coconut Milk Curry: Chingri Malai Curry is a popular Bangladeshi curry that is made with prawns and coconut milk. To make the curry, the prawns are first marinated in turmeric and salt. Then, they are cooked in a sauce made from coconut milk, onion, green chilies, ginger paste, garlic paste, and cumin powder. The curry is then simmered until the prawns are cooked through and the sauce thickens

recipes.name: Pitha
recipes.cooking_method: Pitha is a popular Bangladeshi snack that is made from rice flour, coconut milk, and sugar. To make pitha, a batter is prepared by mixing rice flour, water, and coconut milk. The batter is then flavored with cardamom powder and sugar. The mixture is steamed in small cake molds until cooked through. Finally, the steamed cakes are fried until golden brown

bio: Mehedi Hasan is a talented Bangladeshi chef known for hisinnovative fusion cuisine. With a passion for blending traditional Bangladeshi flavors with those of other cultures, Mehedi Hasan has gained a reputation for creating exciting and unique dishes. As well as running his own restaurant, Mehedi Hasan is a mentor and teacher, sharing his skills with aspiring chefs and promoting Bangladeshi cuisine on a global stage

recipes.name: Bhuna Khichuri (Spiced Lentil and Rice Dish)
recipes.cooking_method: Bhuna Khichuri is a popular Bangladeshi comfort food that is made with lentils and rice. To make Bhuna Khichuri, the lentils and rice are first washed and soaked. Then, they are cooked in a pot with ghee, cumin seeds, bay leaves, cinnamon stick, and cloves. Onions, ginger, garlic, green chilies, and tomatoes are added and sautéed until the mixture is fragrant. Finally, the cooked lentils and rice are added to the pot and mixed with the onion mixture

recipes.name: Shatkora Beef Curry  ( Beef Curry with Citrus Fruit)
recipes.cooking_method: Beef Curry with Citrus Fruit: Shatkora Beef Curry is a flavorful Bangladeshi curry made with beef and shatkora, a citrus fruit found in Bangladesh. To make the curry, beef is marinated with turmeric and salt, then cooked in a pot with oil and onions. The shatkora fruit is added, along with ginger, garlic, cumin, coriander, and red chili powder. The mixture is simmered until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened

recipes.name: Chapor Ghonto (Mixed Vegetable Curry with Dal Patties)
recipes.cooking_method: Chapor Ghonto is a popular Bangladeshi mixed vegetable curry made with dal patties. To make the curry, the dal patties are first made by grinding soaked chana dal, cumin seeds, and green chilies. The mixture is formed into small patties and fried until golden brown. Vegetables such as potatoes, eggplant, and pumpkin are then sautéed in oil with onions and ginger.

bio: Sharuz Riyad is a Bangladeshi chef renowned for his expertise in seafood cuisine. Hailing from the coastal city of Cox's Bazar, Sharuz Riyad has a deep appreciation for fresh seafood and is committed to using sustainable, locally sourced ingredients. After gaining experience at several seafood restaurants in Bangladesh, Sharuz Riyad moved to best 5 star where he gained international acclaim for his visually stunning and delicious seafood dishes

recipes.name: Aloo Posto
recipes.cooking_method: First, peel and cube the potatoes and boil them until they are tender. In a separate pan, heat oil and fry onion until it's soft. Add poppy seed paste, green chilies, salt, and turmeric to the pan and cook for a few minutes. Add the boiled potatoes to the pan and cook for a few more minutes until the potatoes are coated with the poppy seed paste. Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Luchi
recipes.cooking_method: In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, and oil. Gradually add warm water and knead the dough until it's smooth and pliable. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them out into circles. Heat oil in a pan and fry the rolled out dough until they are puffed up and golden brown. Serve hot with potato curry or chana masala

recipes.name: Mishti Doi
recipes.cooking_method: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together yogurt, condensed milk, and sugar until smooth. Divide the mixture into small earthenware pots or any oven-proof container. Cover the pots with foil and place them in a warm place to ferment for about 8 hours or until they are set. Serve chilled as a dessert

bio: Rifat Hossen is a leading Bangladeshi chef in the vegetarian and vegan food movement. With a focus on promoting healthy and sustainable eating habits, Rifat Hossen has gained a reputation for innovative and delicious vegetarian and vegan cuisine. After working at several vegetarian and vegan restaurants in Bangladesh, Rifat Hossen opened his own restaurant, which quickly became popular for its flavorful and creative dishes.

recipes.name: Begun Bhaja (Fried Eggplant)
recipes.cooking_method: Cut the eggplants into thin slices and sprinkle salt over them. Let them rest for 10 minutes to remove excess water. In a bowl, mix turmeric, cumin powder, chili powder, and salt, and coat the eggplant slices in the mixture. Heat oil in a pan and fry the eggplant slices until they are crispy and golden brown. Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Chingri Malai Curry (Prawn Coconut Curry)
recipes.cooking_method: In a pan, heat oil and fry onion until it's soft. Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies, and cook for a few more minutes. Add prawns, salt, turmeric, and water, and cook until the prawns are cooked through. Add coconut milk, garam masala, and coriander leaves to the pan and simmer for a few more minutes until the gravy thickens. Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Mishti Pulao (Sweet Pilaf)
recipes.cooking_method: Wash and soak the rice for 20 minutes. In a pan, heat oil and fry onion until it's soft. Add whole spices like cinnamon, cardamom, and cloves, and fry for a few more minutes. Add the soaked rice, sugar, raisins, and water to the pan and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and let it simmer until the water is absorbed and the rice is cooked through. Serve hot with any meat or vegetable curry

bio: Sadin Shanto is a celebrated Bangladeshi pastry chef known for his delectable desserts. After gaining experience at several pastry shops in Bangladesh, Sadin Shanto opened his/her own bakery, which features creative and unique dessert offerings that incorporate traditional Bangladeshi flavors and ingredients. With a passion for using high-quality ingredients, Sadin Shanto's desserts have earned  a loyal following among dessert enthusiasts.

recipes.name: Murgir Jhol (Chicken Curry)
recipes.cooking_method: :In a pan, heat oil and fry onion until it's soft. Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies, and cook for a few more minutes. Add chicken, salt, turmeric, cumin powder, and water, and cook until the chicken is cooked through. Add diced potatoes, sliced tomatoes, and garam masala to the pan and simmer for a few more minutes until the gravy thickens. Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish (Hilsa Fish in Mustard Sauce)
recipes.cooking_method: Make a paste of mustard seeds, green chilies, and turmeric powder. Marinate the fish in the paste for 30 minutes. In a pan, heat mustard oil and fry the fish until it's golden brown. Add water and salt to the pan and let it cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice

recipes.name: Dhokar Dalna (Bengal Gram Fritters in Gravy)
recipes.cooking_method: Soak chana dal for 4-5 hours and grind it into a fine paste. Add salt, turmeric, cumin powder, and red chili powder to the paste and mix well. Shape the mixture into small cylindrical fritters and steam them for 10-15 minutes. In a pan, heat oil and fry the fritters until they're golden brown

bio: Rakibul Islam is a talented Bangladeshi chef who specializes in traditional Bengali cuisine. After gaining experience at several top restaurants in Bangladesh, Rakibul Islam opened his own restaurant, which has become popular for its delicious and authentic Bengali dishes. With a deep knowledge of local ingredients and cooking techniques, Rakibul Islam is a leading figure in the promotion and preservation of Bengali cuisine.

recipes.name: Chitol Maacher Kalia
recipes.cooking_method: This Bengali fish curry is cooked with chitol fish, turmeric, red chili powder, salt, mustard oil, onions, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, cumin powder, coriander powder, and garam masala

recipes.name: Beef Bhuna
recipes.cooking_method: This spicy beef curry is cooked with beef, onion, garlic, ginger, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, salt, oil, and water. It is slowly simmered until the beef is tender and the spices have infused into the meat

recipes.name: Doi Fuchka
recipes.cooking_method: This popular street food from Bangladesh is made by filling fuchka shells with a mixture of chickpeas, potatoes, tamarind paste, green chilies, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, chat masala, and yogurt. It is then drizzled with more tamarind paste and garnished with cilantro before serving
